ADVANCED.DETAILS: Stark handles more complex cards also, here is an example with subtitle, actions and also the option to have full width elements thanks to the .stark-full-width class added inside the mat-card-content tag.
ADVANCED.TITLE: Advanced card

BASIC.DETAILS:
Stark provides an alternative layout for cards. You can keep the same html structure and add the .stark-card class to the Angular Material card. We also recommend to use h3 tag inside the mat-card-title.


For more information on Angular Material's card, check out this link: https://material.angular.io/components/card/overview
BASIC.TITLE: Basic card

CARD.CODE: Here, the code to display this card:
CARD.TITLE: Stark Cards

ALT.DETAILS: In addition to the 3 basic palettes, Stark provides 3 alternative palettes: $stark-alert-palette, $stark-grey-palette and $stark-success-palette.
ALT.TITLE: Alternative palettes

BASIC.DETAILS:
Angular Material uses 3 color palettes: a primary palette, an accent palette and a warn palette. Stark gives you the ability to define those palettes through 3 SCSS maps: $stark-primary-palette, $stark-accent-palette and $stark-warn-palette.

For more details on how Angular Material deals with theming, check out https://material.angular.io/guide/theming
BASIC.TITLE: Basic palettes

CUSTOM.DETAILS:
If you want to customize those palettes, you first need to create a palette and this tool is really useful: http://mcg.mbitson.com/. Just define your main color and it will generate the full palette, then you just need to copy the SCSS code and associate it to the palette you want to modify. Don't forget to import stark theming after the maps declaration.
Here, an example with default values on how to achieve this:
CUSTOM.TITLE: Customize palettes

LINKS.DETAILS: You can find the Material Design color palettes here: https://material.io/design/color/the-color-system.html#tools-for-picking-colors
LINKS.TITLE: Useful links

DROPDOWN.TITLE: Stark dropdown
DROPDOWN.WHITE: White dropdown on black background (full width)

FOOTER.TITLE: Stark App Footer Guidelines
FOOTER.INTRO: Stark provides you a custom footer for your application. It's a standard component you can use by copying this HTML into your code
FOOTER.INFO: This component takes 3 elements as input :
FOOTER.INPUT1: legalInfoUrl contains the url to the legal information page.
FOOTER.INPUT2: helpPageUrl contains the url to the help page.
FOOTER.INPUT3: The included HTML elements will be copied inside the footer as the leftmost element.

HEADER.COPY_PASTE: Then you can copy/paste this HTML into your code
HEADER.INTEGRATION_DETAILS: Stark provides you with useful classes to implement your application header. You just need to include the header theme in your SCSS
HEADER.STARK_APP_HEADER: The stark-app-header provides a background to the header
HEADER.STARK_APP_BAR: The stark-app-bar contains three content containers stark-app-bar-content-left, stark-app-bar-content-center, stark-app-bar-content-right which split the header in three parts. All the direct children of those 3 containers will be aligned in a column. The stark-app-bar also provides a stark-app-bar-page-title which is placed on the bottom left of the header.
HEADER.STARK_APP_BAR_CONTENT_RIGHT: stark-app-bar-content-right contains 3 containers, the first one for the App Data component and the logout button, the second for language selection and stark-app-bar-content-right-actions-alt which contains some alternative actions.
HEADER.TITLE: Stark App Header Guidelines

ON_ENTER_KEY.DESCRIPTION: Type some value in the inputs and then press Enter in any of them to trigger the callback function
ON_ENTER_KEY.INPUT_WITHOUT_CONTEXT: Without bound context (bound values are not accessible)
ON_ENTER_KEY.INPUT_WITHOUT_CONTEXT_ALTERNATIVE: Without bound context but passed as parameter
ON_ENTER_KEY.TITLE: On Enter Key Directive
ON_ENTER_KEY.TYPE_AND_PRESS_ENTER: Type a value and press Enter
ON_ENTER_KEY.TYPE_PRESS_ENTER_AND_CHECK_CONSOLE: Type a value, press Enter and check the console

RESTRICT_INPUT.TITLE: Restrict Input Directive
RESTRICT_INPUT.DESCRIPTION: Type some value in the inputs and some characters will be prevented depending on the restriction set in every field

MESSAGE_PANE.DESCRIPTION: The Message Pane will persist on the page until dismissed, but will not stop page interactions (like dialogs do). It can be used, for instance, to show validation errors of the form in case your app needs to keep them until dismissed.

ERRORS.ERROR_1: Error 1: Too many fingers on the keyboard - priority 500

MESSAGE_PANE.TITLE: Stark message pane

SIDEBAR.INTRO: The preview of this code is the actual sidebar of the showcase
SIDEBAR.TITLE: Stark app sidebar

TOAST.MESSAGE_CLOSED_ON_DELAY_TIMEOUT: Toast closed automatically after delay timeout.
TOAST.MESSAGE_CLOSED_BY_NEW_TOAST: Toast automatically closed before displaying a new one.
TOAST.MESSAGE_INTRO: Click one button to test the toast notification.
TOAST.TITLE: Stark toast notification

CUSTOMIZATION.TITLE: Customization
CUSTOMIZATION.DETAILS:
Stark allows you to customize simultaneously the typography settings of Angular Material and Stark easily by adding a simple SCSS map declaration.
First, declare the SCSS map and then you need to import the Stark's theme. On this example, a full version of the map is shown but you can also use it partially.
CUSTOMIZATION.MAP_EXPLAINED: Here are the corresponding classes and tags:

FONT_FAMILY.TITLE: Font family
FONT_FAMILY.DETAILS_1: Material Design does not require to use a specific font, but it suggests Roboto, the sans-serif font available on Android mobile devices. We have chosen to let the system decide the most readable font it has to offer. This has the added advantage that no font will be embedded, reducing the first page load time.
FONT_FAMILY.DETAILS_2: The font stack used to get the optimal sans-serif font the system provides:
FONT_FAMILY.CUSTOM_FONT_EXPLAINED: To set a web font (eg: Roboto) you must first add the font (ttf, woff, ...) to your projects assets, add it as a font-face in SCSS and set it trough the $stark-typography-theme (more about customization below).
FONT_FAMILY.IE_NOTE: * The font format woff2 is not supported by IE. MDN
FONT_FAMILY.CDN_FONT_EXPLAINED: To set a web font from an external source (CDN) webpack needs to be told to allow fonts from external sources. To do this add a the host/port to cspFontSrc in config/webpack-custom-config.dev.json. For more details check out: CSP: font-src .

MATERIAL_BASED.DETAILS: We try to keep consistency with Angular Material. For more details checkout: https://material.angular.io/guide/typography
MATERIAL_BASED.TITLE: Based on Angular Material

HOMEPAGE.DESCRIPTION_BEFORE_DETAIL:
Stark is an Angular 5+ based front-end framework built on top of Angular Stark features... An awesome reusable build using Webpack, built-in support for state of the art front-end tech.

Stark provides main building blocks for accelerating front-end development:
HOMEPAGE.DESCRIPTION_DETAIL:
• a solid reusable build based on Webpack
  • a starter project inspired by Angular Starter by AngularClass and Google's Web Starterk Kit
  • core modules providing useful APIs
  • UI modules providing interesting UI components
  • a showcase application containing:
    • our living style guide
    • a showcase of all components/services along with their API
    • our developer guide
HOMEPAGE.DESCRIPTION_AFTER_DETAIL:
Stark modules are like LEGO blocks: add what you need, no less, no more. If you don't like our defaults then you may replace/override/ignore anything you fancy.

And even better, the Stark repository is available on the National Bank of Belgium page on Github!

Come and have a look at our amazing open sources projects!
HOMEPAGE.NEWS_DESCRIPTION: Want to find the hottest news about the Stark framework?
HOMEPAGE.NEWS_CONTENT: Have a look at the news page right here!
HOMEPAGE.DOCUMENTATION_MAIN_DESC: Want some more info about Stark? Take a look at our links just below!
HOMEPAGE.DOCUMENTATION_CORE_DESC:
Stark Core, aka stark-core, is a module providing reusable APIs, such as a routing, logging, log shipping, etc.

You can find the latest API documentation for stark-core here.

Or check the API for previous releases right here.
HOMEPAGE.DOCUMENTATION_UI_DESC:
Stark UI provides reusable UI components, for example data table, message pane, ... but also themes.

The latest API doc for that module can be found here.

Or check the API for previous releases right here.
HOMEPAGE.DOCUMENTATION_SHOWCASE_DESC:
The showcase application is the application you are actually browsing right now!

Enjoy roaming through our list of visual components (and their documentation) and have fun while discovering our design guidelines.

If you are interested in seeing the previous version of Stark showcase, have a look here.
